answerText: superconductivity[10] In this effect, superconductors become superdiamagnetic due to drop-off of magnetic flux.  The material thus excludes its internal magnetic field.

subject: Science
question: Question: The operation of this effect is explained by BCS theory, and electrons in materials exhibiting it group into Cooper pairs.   [10] Name this phenomenon in which materials below a critical temperature experience no electrical resistance.
